org.frustra.filament

Class Hooks

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.frustra.filament.Hooks

  • public class Hooks
extends Object
    The Hooks class defines all the code for processing hooks. The results of each hook can be set and read with methods in this class.

    Hook results are mapped to strings, and generally have one of the following formats: 

         ClassName
     ClassName.fieldName
     ClassName.methodName
     ClassName.someProperty
    Hooks that are prefixed with a class will automatically be handled when using utility functions within HookUtil
    See Also:
    HookUtil

      • loadHooks

        public static final void loadHooks(String packageName)
                            throws ReflectiveOperationException,
                                   org.frustra.filament.hooking.BadHookException,
                                   IOException
        Load all hooks contained within the specified package, and run them on the global Filament instance. A FilamentClassLoader must be created in order to initialize the Filament instance.

        A hook is any class that extends Hook. Hooks will not be run unless they implement a HookingPass.

        Any hooks loaded with a previous call to loadHooks will be overwritten.

        Parameters:
        packageName - the name of the package containing hooks
        Throws:
        ReflectiveOperationException - if the package or any classes cannot be loaded
        org.frustra.filament.hooking.BadHookException - if there is an error while processing the hooks
        IOException - if one of the hook classes could not be read
        See Also:
        Hook, HookingPass
